Params: Lucia walks aimlessly among the city ruins.
The city feels fresh after the rain, with the dust and ashes in the air washed away.
Lucia has not taken her time to walk on this ravaged planet ever since she finished her Construct training and began to serve.
Ravenge was calculating and strategic-minded, even amongst the commandants of the elite squads.
He would consider every Construct's battle power in his calculation and allocate time for their maintenance during continuous battles, maximizing efficiency while minimizing casualty.
Decisive, outstanding, and kind... this was how the Task Force and Gray Raven thought of Ravenge, and he certainly acted the part.
Her frame is heavily damaged, especially her right arm. We'll have to replace it at this point. Sign here.
How long will it take for her to recover?
Some of the custom parts require an application before they can be sent here. It'll be another week before she can be deployed again.
Now, I know the fight is rough out there, and elite squads like yours are needed everywhere.
But you need to let your teammates rest and sleep. Their M.I.N.D. stability is much worse than what it was during the last inspection.
I'll submit the request. With your support, Command Central has to consider my time-off application seriously, right?
The doctor looks at the gravely wounded Lucia with sympathy and shakes his head.

I've said the same thing to many people many times, but most don't listen. A lot of commandants don't take M.I.N.D. stability seriously, thinking that they can just connect with the Constructs to alleviate the problem.

But it's never this simple. Injuries and exhaustion accumulate and become a time bomb in the M.I.N.D. Without proper rest, the M.I.N.D. will continuously be exhausted, and a connection can only treat it temporarily.
The doctor puts away his clipboard and gives a few more suggestions before leaving.
That's not up to you. The doctor, your teammates, and I all agree that you must rest and perform maintenance here this time.
I'm sorry. If Xun and I had stopped those Corrupted...
It wasn't your fault. Other squads were in charge of those Corrupted. We never planned for them.
I'll request a temporary pause on the operation to City 015. Gray Raven can take a break here.
But people still need our help there...
Ravenge speaks in his usual low and calm tone.
I know you wanted to help them, and I know you are more than capable. But you can't save everyone, and not everyone needs to be saved by you.
There are many other elite squads on Babylonia aside from Gray Raven. They will complete the rescue mission.
Trust your teammates. Trust Babylonia. And...
Trust my judgment the same way I trust you.
Lucia is going to say something, but Xun and Murol stop her.
Understood. I will perform my maintenance as quickly as possible.
Let me report this battle to the higher-up first. I'll also request some downtime.
Ravenge opens his terminal and heads outside the field hospital.
It's okay, Lucia. Commandant was right. You don't have to shoulder everything.
I didn't expect a life of leisure when I signed up to become a Construct, but the bosses can't keep working us like this.
Alright, stop complaining. At least Gray Raven hasn't lost anyone yet. We fare much better than the other squads.
But I'm not complaining about Gray Raven or Commandant! It's the people from Command Central. They have no idea how hard we work!
There's only so much Commandant is allowed to do. Gray Raven has been performing well, so the Command Central values his opinion.
But that's as far as it goes. Commandant can't change what the top brass thinks.
At most, he can fight for some missions.
Sigh. When will Commandant get promoted to the Command Central? He'll definitely change things up and make our lives better if he works there.
This isn't something one man can change. Not to mention that we'll need a replacement if Commandant gets promoted. Can you guarantee they'll be better than Commandant?
Military Constructs like us don't get to be promoted to the Command Central. Maybe the smart ones get to join the Engineering Force or the Archaeological Team.
But ask yourself, are you one of the smart ones?
Sigh. I don't want a new commandant... but promotion will be great for him. How conflicting...
I wonder what other people will say about our utter defeat this time.
I knew jealous people were talking behind our backs. "Gray Raven only picks the important missions," "Gray Raven is so darn lucky..." Gray Raven this, Gray Raven that.
I'm so sorry. If I were a little bit faster, we wouldn't have...
You push yourself too much, Lucia.
Didn't you hear what Commandant said? You don't have to do everything. Try to trust other people more.
But Commandant also said that the sooner we defeat the Corrupted, the sooner we reclaim Earth.
That's not something a small elite squad like us can accomplish.
Honestly, my biggest wish is to live long enough to retire and teach at the training camp.
The same goes for me. You aren't planning to stay on the front line, are you, Lucia?
I will fight until that day arrives or my last breath.
What can I say? Seeing you like this makes me believe that day will arrive.
I suppose Xun and I need to pull our weight as well. We can't keep asking you to take on everything.
Stop making decisions for me! I would have said that myself.
Said what? What did I miss?
Hiro returns to the break room after being called away earlier.
You're right on time, Hiro. We're talking about destroying the Corrupted and reclaiming Earth.
You skipped over a few details, man...
A few minutes ago, outside the field hospital.
Lucia should be treated on Babylonia. Why did you request maintenance here on the surface instead?
Hiro lowers his voice as he says that.
He's the key to reclaiming Earth. We must catch him!
Are you sure about our chances?
I'll request reinforcement. If he's hostile toward us, we'll have to capture him by force or eliminate him.
They might not believe you since your recording device was damaged, and we have no proof.
But I'll bet my reputation to try to convince them.
Right. This is too important. Don't let Lucia and the rest know yet.
Seeing the hesitation on Hiro's face, Ravenge pats him on his shoulder.
Hiro, you're the one I trust the most, not Lucia. Didn't I send your daughter to a private hospital to get treatment?
We're the ones who can share secrets with each other, aren't we?

Ravenge needs to submit a few requests and plan for the upcoming operations, so he leaves quickly after stressing a few more times. Hiro returns to the break room, upset to find himself hiding from his teammates.
Even though this is not the first time he withholds something for Ravenge.
Nothing... Xun was right. We can only reclaim Earth if we destroy all the Corrupted.
Lucia used to think that way too. The Punishing Virus has taken too much from her.
When she was a human, she would swing her dagger to protect Luna.
After becoming a Construct, she would sharpen her katana to take revenge on the Punishing Virus.
But she no longer has to worry about survival, and Luna has become more powerful than her.
The humans betrayed Lucia's trust and ideals and sacrificed Luna and her. The Punishing Virus was the thing that saved them after humanity's betrayal.
Where should she stay? Where should she go? What should she fight for?
What will her hatred, her ideals, and her trust rest upon?
Is everything she has ever done just a futile effort in this meaningless whirlpool of fate?
Without thinking, Lucia rushes toward the sound out of habit.
